WRITING.TITLE: Apples 2, Oil on Canvas Board, 11" x 14"

WRITING.TEXT: Messing around with this, I see it will be difficult to both draft for max value AND to make the best possible deck.
I can see that, it is less casual, and I assume a big part of the draw of Commander is how casual it is.

I think I have slightly more Magic cards, but not by much. I wish Commander players knew how good this game was - a game designed by Richard Garfield **for multiplayer** , revolving around frikkin' vampires.
VTES in August? I'm on my way.
If you haven't already, give the thrift store your contact info in case the mother or the boy come back to get the cards, so they can relay the info.
This isn't a complaint, just a question, how do you make another Modern Masters after this one?

People are excited for this reprint because it is fairly expensive and this reprint will make it more accessible (cheaper) for people to get. The argument for this card being good for the game is that it keeps people from getting too greedy with their mana base when deck building, it sort of keeps people in check. Although, there are plenty of people that agree with you.
What I mean is, it goes against the theme of the set. It is obviously powerful, but possibly a bad choice for the theme they were going for in limited. It will ruin everybody's fun.
It's a great reprint, but isn't this horrible for limited with a set based on multi-color?
I've played draft twice in my life, so I'm no expert, but h-h-h...how does one NOT draft this set? It looks amazing on all levels.

The art is "prettier" but doesn't fit the action/chaos of the what the card does as well as the original. This one almost seems serene by comparison. I'm not complaining, it's ok to have different versions, but both have strengths.
JACE COINCIDING WITH UNBANNING
Thank you so much. Kind of funny because I don't like to eat fruit, but they are fun to paint.
Thank you, that means a lot :)
Thank you! Glad you like it.
"You like Magic, I like Solitaire"
This needs more upvotes.
Nah, I'm just old, he he. Enjoy this time of discovery.

I think it was back in '94 when my brother showed me Magic cards, and I said to him "Why didn't you tell me about this?!", I was actually pissed. I hadn't even played the game at that point, I just saw them.
I don't care about commander, and I don't like foils, but this is really something.
Well, he was your friend. Not sure you can pull that one off against a stranger.
Storm in Modern. It's not that it's too good, it doesn't even matter if I win or lose, it's a horrible experience regardless. You just sit there waiting as minutes get shaved off of your life.
I actually looked this up before posting, I think I'm right? http://writingexplained.org/passed-vs-past-difference
I'm sorry, I can't get passed "loose".

How much of the vehicle's deck power comes from the creatures though? [[Veteran Motorist]] and [[Toolcraft Exemplar]] are pretty outrageous. You could look at it as a mistake for standard, but over all I think the risk in terms of power level and coolness factor in the long term was worth it.

This makes sense in the context of testing. When you trust everybody on the team and cheating isn't an issue, I would assume Cockatrice is faster (I've never played MTGO). Also faster than paper magic in terms of deck building/tuning.
I'm an artist and I've never bought another piece of art in my life. But I am tempted by the [[Ivory Gargoyle]] sketch.

This is my favorite, and I've never played Vintage either. I will actually save episodes of this for long road trips. I feel like no other podcast goes as deep and thorough as they do. They had an entire episode just about [[Gitaxian Probe]]. But yes, the set reviews are the most fascinating and fun.

Wow, I had no idea. Back when Legends was on it's way out, my brother was able to get a single pack for me, for which I payed 12 dollars. This was the rare. I traded it a million years ago. I would not have guessed this price.
Damn, pretty amazing.

WRITING.TITLE: Tree, Oil on Canvas Board, 11" x 14"

WRITING.TEXT: WHAT?! - Me, out loud.

I have the feeling, justified by evidence or not, that it is going to replace Modern. I'm not sure what Frontier is like because I haven't done any research, but I'd imagine that Frontier feels like what we want Modern to feel like - that is, a format that is not "figured out" and ripe for experimentation. Modern in comparison to that seems more like Legacy.

WRITING.TITLE: Seascape, Oil on Canvas Board, 10" x 8"

WRITING.TEXT: Can't stop that flying cardboard thopter though.
Thanks!
